message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.SD

This paper explores the tactic of content republishing in the news ecosystem, which involves analyzing the verbatim copying of content across news producers. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including social media analysis (cs.SI), information retrieval (cs.IR), natural language processing (cs.CL), cybersecurity (cs.CY), and software engineering (cs.SD). The paper uses network analysis to identify patterns in the distribution of content across different news communities, which is a common technique in social media analysis. It also involves analyzing the text of news articles, which is relevant to information retrieval and natural language processing. The paper also discusses the potential implications of content republishing for cybersecurity and software engineering, as it can be used to spread misinformation and manipulate public opinion. Overall, the paper touches on several different areas of computer science, but the focus on social media analysis and information retrieval make cs.SI and cs.IR the most likely sub-categories.
